author: .vbuterin
content: Yeah I think the biggest barriers to SC wallet adoption are (i) abstraction issues (can't put validation in the pre-gas-payment-commitment logic), and (ii) higher gas costs

author: .vbuterin
content: Of course, a solution to (i) would also greatly mitigate (ii)

author: .vbuterin
content: What fork would a SELFDESTRUCT behavior change be conceivably good for (I'm thinking replace the opcode's behavior with "send entire remaining balance to target as a call and do nothing else")? Shanghai? I also remember this channel had the idea of fixing the block number very early but making it reasonably far in the future

author: .vbuterin
content: Because neutering it breaks less functionality, and I would also add that in the future a "send all" operation is a legitimate behavior

author: .vbuterin
content: For example, smart contract wallets post-EIP-1559

author: .vbuterin
content: post-EIP-1559 you can't predict exactly what fee you'll pay, so the "neutered self-destruct as send-all" would help accounts full-clear their balance

author: .vbuterin
content: I'd argue it is a prerequisite for a verkle tree change, because any tree structure change becomes considerably simpler if we don't have to worry about the possibility of an arbitrary number of storage slots being zeroed out
